trans-unit.source: A mutable collection of objects derived from the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal"></xref> class.
This class is designed to be used for multi-valued properties that contain Principals.

Manipulating the contents of this collection changes the contents of the corresponding store property, which is made permanent when <xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal.Save*> is called on the corresponding principal object.
Adds the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.ComputerPrincipal"></xref> object to the end of the collection

This function can throw the following exceptions: |Exception|Description| |---------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalExistsException>|`computer` already exists in the collection.|
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.ComputerPrincipal"></xref> object.
Adds the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.GroupPrincipal"></xref> object to the end of the collection

This function can throw the following exceptions: |Exception|Description| |---------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalExistsException>|`group` already exists in the collection.|
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.ComputerPrincipal"></xref> object.
Adds the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal"></xref> object to the end of the collection

This function can throw the following exceptions: |Exception|Description| |---------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalExistsException>|`principal` already exists in the collection.|
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal"></xref> object.
Adds the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.UserPrincipal"></xref> object to the end of the collection

This function can throw the following exceptions: |Exception|Description| |---------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalExistsException>|`user` already exists in the collection.|
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.UserPrincipal"></xref> object
Searches for a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal"></xref> object that matches the parameters, and adds it to the end of the collection.

This function can throw the following exceptions: |Exception|Description| |---------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalExistsException>|The principal matching these parameters already exists in the collection.| |<xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.NoMatchingPrincipalException>|No principal matching the specified parameters was found.| |<xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.MultipleMatchesException>|More than one principal matches the specified parameters.| |<xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.ArgumentException>|Thrown when `identityType` is an empty string|
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalContext"></xref> object for the principal to be added to the collection.
An <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.IdentityType"></xref> object that specifies the format of `identityValue`
A string that identifies the principal, in the format specified by `identityType`
Removes all Principals from the collection.

This function can throw the following exceptions: |Exception|Description| |---------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.InvalidOperation>|If this method is called on the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.GroupPrincipal.Members> PrincipalCollection, the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.GroupPrincipal.Members> property cannot be cleared because one or more of the group's members have this group as their primary group|
Returns true if the collection contains the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.ComputerPrincipal"></xref> object.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.ComputerPrincipal"></xref> object.
Returns a <xref uid="langword_csharp_bool" name="bool" href=""></xref>.
Returns true if the collection contains the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.GroupPrincipal"></xref> object.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.GroupPrincipal"></xref> object
Returns a <xref uid="langword_csharp_bool" name="bool" href=""></xref>.
Returns true if the collection contains the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal"></xref> object.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal"></xref> object
Returns a <xref uid="langword_csharp_bool" name="bool" href=""></xref>.
Returns true if the collection contains the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.UserPrincipal"></xref> object.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.UserPrincipal"></xref> object.
Returns a <xref uid="langword_csharp_bool" name="bool" href=""></xref>.
Returns true if the object matching the indentityType/idendityValue pair is in the collection

This function can throw the following exceptions: |Exception|Description| |---------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.MultipleMatchesException>|There are multiple principals matching these parameters.| |<xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.ArgumentException>|The `identityType` parameter cannot be empty.|
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalContext"></xref> object of the principal.
An <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.IdentityType"></xref> object that specifies the format of `identityValue`
A string that identifies the principal, in the format specified by `identityType`
Returns a <xref uid="langword_csharp_bool" name="bool" href=""></xref>.

Copies the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal"></xref> objects from this <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalCollection"></xref> into the specified array, starting at the specified position index in array.
`array` must be one-dimensional.
If it is not, an <xref:System.ArgumentException> is thrown.
Further exceptions are thrown if the number of elements to copy is greater than the available space from `index` to the end of `array`, if `array` is `null`, or if `index` is less than 0.
The <xref:System.Array> that should be populated with <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal"></xref> objects.
The position in `array` into which the first principal object in the collection should be copied.
Returns the count of Principal objects in this collection.
To be added.
Returns an enumerator to iterate through the principals in the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalCollection"></xref>.
Conceptually, each instance of <xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalCollection> has a single enumerator associated with it.

Although multiple calls to <xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalCollection.System.Collections.IEnumerable.GetEnumerator%2A> return distinct <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> objects, they share the same internal state.
An <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> containing the principals in the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalCollection"></xref>.
Returns false.
This is not a read-only collection.
Returns a <xref uid="langword_csharp_bool" name="bool" href=""></xref>.
Returns false.
It is up to the application to serialize access to this collection.
Returns a <xref uid="langword_csharp_bool" name="bool" href=""></xref>.

Removes the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.ComputerPrincipal"></xref> object from the collection, and returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.ComputerPrincipal"></xref> was a member of this <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalCollection"></xref>, and <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> otherwise (in which case the method performs no operation).

This function can throw the following exceptions: |Exception|Description| |---------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.InvalidOperation>|This method was called on the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.GroupPrincipal.Members> collection for a domain group, and the domain principal to be removed is a member of the group by virtue of its `primaryGroupId` attribute.|
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.ComputerPrincipal"></xref> object.
Returns a <xref uid="langword_csharp_bool" name="bool" href=""></xref>.

Removes the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.GroupPrincipal"></xref> object from the collection, and returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.GroupPrincipal"></xref> was a member of this <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalCollection"></xref>, and <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> otherwise (in which case the method performs no operation).

This function can throw the following exceptions: |Exception|Description| |---------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.InvalidOperation>|This method was called on the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.GroupPrincipal.Members> collection for a domain group, and the domain principal to be removed is a member of the group by virtue of its `primaryGroupId` attribute.|
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.GroupPrincipal"></xref> object.
Returns a <xref uid="langword_csharp_bool" name="bool" href=""></xref>.

Removes the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal"></xref> object from the collection, and returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal"></xref> was a member of this <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalCollection"></xref>, and <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> otherwise (in which case the method performs no operation).

This function can throw the following exceptions: |Exception|Description| |---------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.InvalidOperation>|This method was called on the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.GroupPrincipal.Members> collection for a domain group, and the domain principal to be removed is a member of the group by virtue of its `primaryGroupId` attribute.|
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal"></xref> object.
Returns a <xref uid="langword_csharp_bool" name="bool" href=""></xref>.

Removes the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.UserPrincipal"></xref> object from the collection, and returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.UserPrincipal"></xref> was a member of this <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalCollection"></xref>, and <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> otherwise (in which case the method performs no operation).

This function can throw the following exceptions: |Exception|Description| |---------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.InvalidOperation>|This method was called on the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.GroupPrincipal.Members> collection for a domain group, and the domain principal to be removed is a member of the group by virtue of its `primaryGroupId` attribute.|
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.UserPrincipal"></xref> object.
Returns a <xref uid="langword_csharp_bool" name="bool" href=""></xref>.

Finds the object specified by the given and identityType/identityValue pair from the collection, and returns if the identified was a member of this , and otherwise (in which case the method performs no operation).

This function can throw the following exceptions: |Exception|Description| |---------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.InvalidOperation>|This method was called on the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.GroupPrincipal.Members> collection for a domain group, and the domain principal to be removed is a member of the group by virtue of its `primaryGroupId` attribute.| |<xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.NoMatchingPrincipalException>|No principal matching the specified parameters was found.| |<xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.MultipleMatchesException>|More than one principal matches the specified parameters.

In theory, this should never happen, because <xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalCollection.Add%2A> throws an exception when there is an attempt to add duplicate principals to the collection.
However, it is possible that another API created the duplicate.| |<xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.ArgumentException>|Thrown when `identityType` is an empty string.|
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalContext"></xref> object.
An <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.IdentityType"></xref> that identifies the format of `identityValue`.
A string.
Returns a <xref uid="langword_csharp_bool" name="bool" href=""></xref>.
Returns a synchronization object that can be used to synchronize access to this collection.
Returns the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalCollection"></xref> object itself.

Copies the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal"></xref> objects from this <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalCollection"></xref> into the specified array, starting at the specified position index in array.
`array` must be one-dimensional.
If it is not, an <xref:System.ArgumentException> is thrown.
Further exceptions are thrown if the number of elements to copy is greater than the available space from `index` to the end of `array`, if `array` is `null`, or if `index` is less than 0.
The T:System.Array that should be populated with <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal"></xref> objects.
The position in `array` to which the first <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal"></xref> object should be copied to.
Returns the count of Principal objects in this collection.
Returns an <xref uid="langword_csharp_integer" name="integer" href=""></xref>.
Always returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
It is up to the application to synchronize access to this collection.
Always returns `false`.
Returns a <xref uid="langword_csharp_bool" name="bool" href=""></xref>.
Returns a synchronization object that can be used to synchronize access to this collection.
Returns the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalCollection"></xref> object itself.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalCollection"></xref> object.
Returns an enumerator to iterate through the principals in the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalCollection"></xref>.
Conceptually, each instance of <xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalCollection> has a single enumerator associated with it.

Although multiple calls to <xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalCollection.System.Collections.IEnumerable.GetEnumerator%2A> return distinct <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> objects, they share the same internal state.
An <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> containing the principals in the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalCollection"></xref>.
